intro: Hieracium chondrillifolium subsp. morascanum, commonly known as the Morascan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found in disturbed or marginal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and localized species within its range.
